_source.content: "Speaker McCarthy"Ilhan Omar said that my decision to remove her from the House Foreign Affairs committee, and Adam Schiff and Eric Swalwell from the Intelligence Committee, is a ‚Äúthreat to national security‚Äù.Let me be blunt: national security is precisely why I removed these three from their respective committees. I‚Äôve said it many times before, and I‚Äôll say it again:Adam Schiff‚Äôs abuse of his position on the Intel Committee to LIE in pursuit of President Trump proves his inability to put national security and integrity over partisan games.Eric Swalwell‚Äôs relationship with a Chinese spy is quite literally the definition of jeopardizing national security, which is why the FBI briefed me on the matter.And Ilhan Omar‚Äôs openly anti-semitic statements and stance directly imperil our alliance with our #1 ally in the Middle East: Israel.I am returning the Intelligence Committee to one of genuine honesty and credibility that regains the trust of the American people.I promised I‚Äôd restore accountability to your government. Now I am delivering, and the Democrats are FURIOUS.
_source.contentraw:
"Speaker McCarthy"

Ilhan Omar said that my decision to remove her from the House Foreign Affairs committee, and Adam Schiff and Eric Swalwell from the Intelligence Committee, is a ‚Äúthreat to national security‚Äù.

Let me be blunt: national security is precisely why I removed these three from their respective committees. I‚Äôve said it many times before, and I‚Äôll say it again:

Adam Schiff‚Äôs abuse of his position on the Intel Committee to LIE in pursuit of President Trump proves his inability to put national security and integrity over partisan games.

Eric Swalwell‚Äôs relationship with a Chinese spy is quite literally the definition of jeopardizing national security, which is why the FBI briefed me on the matter.

And Ilhan Omar‚Äôs openly anti-semitic statements and stance directly imperil our alliance with our #1 ally in the Middle East: Israel.

I am returning the Intelligence Committee to one of genuine honesty and credibility that regains the trust of the American people.

I promised I‚Äôd restore accountability to your government. Now I am delivering, and the Democrats are FURIOUS.

It Wasn't Pretty But It's 2 Standings Points: Capitals Beat Blue Jackets 4-3 in OT

The Washington Capitals headed into an 10-day break (All-Star weekend plus the team's bye week), but they had this one last road game tonight against the Columbus Blue Jackets. Thankfully, the Caps pulled out a 4-3 OT win to wrap-up the first half of the season.

Here's the scoring summary.

Capitals' forward Garnet Hathaway tipped center Lars Eller‚Äôs shot to give Washington an early lead in the first period. Then Capitals' D-man Trevor van Riemsdyk extended the lead with a blue-line bomb. That two-goal lead lasted 12 seconds, which is when CBJ's Andrew Peeke needed two deflections to beat Washington goalie Charlie Lindgren.

In the second stanza, van Riemsdyk received a great pass from Washington's All-Star Center Evgeny Kuznetsov to restore the Caps‚Äô two-goal lead, but it didn‚Äôt last long. Columbus' Eric Robinson smoked T.J. Oshie‚Äôs line to score on the rush.

In the third frame, Blue Jackets' "Johnny Hockey" Gaudreau knotted the game at three goals with seven minutes left. The Jackets pushed late, but the Caps survived through regulation. So it was onto 3-on-3 overtime hockey.

In the OT period, Kuznetsov scored in 26 seconds, thanks to a great setup from Washington winger Marcus Johansson.

The Caps need a break. In addition to their full-fledged injuries, there are clearly some players playing through "stuff": Oshie and Ovechkin likely are ailing and I wouldn‚Äôt be surprised if D-man Dmitry Orlov is hurting, too. If the last name starts with O, this is a good time to kick back and get a tan. Ten days of very welcome rest begins now.

Next Up: After this 10-day break, the Capitals travel to Boston to take on the No. 1 Bruins in a nationally televised matinee game Feb. 11. It will be the first of a home-and-home, back-to-back series with the second matinee game against the San Jose Sharks the next day here in D.C.

Capitals beat Blue Jackets 4-3 in OT!
#nocaps

_source.content: #China #EspionageBiden‚Äôs China Spy ScandalAmerican Greatness ^ | 31 Jan, 2023 | Lloyd Billingsleyhttps://amgreatness.com/2023/01/31/bidens-china-spy-scandal/It‚Äôs even worse than his classified documents scandal.Joe Biden is taking heat for the classified documents he stashed at his home and garage. Though well worthy of attention, as Victor Davis Hanson notes, the documents scandal has overshadowed Biden‚Äôs indulgence of Chinese spies, on full display in a recent case.‚ÄúFederal prosecutors in Brooklyn have dropped their case against a New York Police Department officer who had been accused of acting as a foreign agent on behalf of the Chinese regime,‚Äù The Epoch Times reports.Baimadajie Angwang, 33, an ethnic Tibetan and naturalized U.S. citizen, was arrested in 2020 for acting as an agent of Beijing, for wire fraud, making false statements, and obstructing an official proceeding. Prosecutors charge that Angwang reported on Chinese citizens, cultivated intelligence sources, and connected Chinese officials with senior contacts in the New York Police Department.The U.S. Attorney‚Äôs Office of the Eastern District of New York recently filed a motion asking federal Judge Eric R. Komitee, a Trump nominee, to dismiss the indictment due to ‚Äúadditional information.‚Äù The Eastern District did not reveal the information or explain its relevance to the case. The move illuminates official Biden policy toward Chinese espionage in the United States.‚ÄúThe Justice Department is ending a controversial program, launched under the Trump administration, to hunt down Chinese spies,‚Äù CBS News reported last year. President Trump‚Äôs ‚ÄúChina Initiative‚Äù targeted China‚Äôs theft of trade secrets and intellectual property.As federal prosecutors charged in 2017, MIT professor Gang Chen failed to disclose ties to China and failed to disclose a foreign bank account on a tax document. Prosecutors dropped the case against Chen, but it wasn‚Äôt clear what motivated them to act. This was hardly the only proceeding against Chinese agents the Justice Department chose to abandon.In 2020, federal officials changed that Chinese national Tang Juan lied about ties to the Chinese military in order to gain access to the University of California at Davis. The FBI found an April 14, 2019 article on a Xi‚Äôan, China, healthcare forum that showed Tang in a military uniform bearing the insignia of the Civilian Cadres of the Chinese People‚Äôs Liberation Army (PLA). The FBI also found two other articles listing Tang‚Äôs employer as the People‚Äôs Liberation Army‚Äôs Air Force Medical University (AFMU), also known as the Fourth Military Medical University (FMMU).According to court documents, Tang was part of a PLA operation to send military scientists to the United States with false covers or false statements about their true employment. Military superiors in China tasked the spies to copy and steal information from American institutions.Tang Juan also emerged in the visa fraud case of Song Chen. According to July 20, 2020, court documents, ‚Äúan active duty People‚Äôs Liberation Army (PLA) military scientist who lied to get into the United States, attempted to destroy evidence, and lied extensively to the FBI when interviewed.‚ÄùThe documents also cite Wang Xin, a visiting researcher at the University of California at San Francisco arrested on charges of visa fraud. Wang was ‚Äúin fact an active duty member in the PLA, at a level that roughly corresponded with the level of major in the United States.‚Äù Wang had ‚Äúemailed UCSF research to his PLA laboratory,‚Äù and his supervisor in China tasked Wang ‚Äúto observe and document the layout of the UCSF lab to replicate it when he returned to China.‚ÄùThe court documents refer to Tang Juan, also in the United States on a J-1 visa. So was a Chinese national identified as ‚ÄúLT,‚Äù who gained access to Duke University despite affiliations with ‚Äúthe PLA General Hospital and PLA Medical Academy.‚Äù Americans have cause to wonder why the visas were granted in the first place.A simple internet search turned up PLA and CCP ties for Tang Juan and others now facing charges. The court documents do not reveal which U.S. government officials granted the visas, and what they knew when they approved Chinese nationals with PLA and Chinese Communist Party (CCP) ties.

#China #Espionage
Biden‚Äôs China Spy Scandal
American Greatness ^ | 31 Jan, 2023 | Lloyd Billingsley
https://amgreatness.com/2023/01/31/bidens-china-spy-scandal/

It‚Äôs even worse than his classified documents scandal.

Joe Biden is taking heat for the classified documents he stashed at his home and garage. Though well worthy of attention, as Victor Davis Hanson notes, the documents scandal has overshadowed Biden‚Äôs indulgence of Chinese spies, on full display in a recent case.

‚ÄúFederal prosecutors in Brooklyn have dropped their case against a New York Police Department officer who had been accused of acting as a foreign agent on behalf of the Chinese regime,‚Äù The Epoch Times reports.

Baimadajie Angwang, 33, an ethnic Tibetan and naturalized U.S. citizen, was arrested in 2020 for acting as an agent of Beijing, for wire fraud, making false statements, and obstructing an official proceeding. Prosecutors charge that Angwang reported on Chinese citizens, cultivated intelligence sources, and connected Chinese officials with senior contacts in the New York Police Department.

The U.S. Attorney‚Äôs Office of the Eastern District of New York recently filed a motion asking federal Judge Eric R. Komitee, a Trump nominee, to dismiss the indictment due to ‚Äúadditional information.‚Äù The Eastern District did not reveal the information or explain its relevance to the case. The move illuminates official Biden policy toward Chinese espionage in the United States.

‚ÄúThe Justice Department is ending a controversial program, launched under the Trump administration, to hunt down Chinese spies,‚Äù CBS News reported last year. President Trump‚Äôs ‚ÄúChina Initiative‚Äù targeted China‚Äôs theft of trade secrets and intellectual property.

As federal prosecutors charged in 2017, MIT professor Gang Chen failed to disclose ties to China and failed to disclose a foreign bank account on a tax document. Prosecutors dropped the case against Chen, but it wasn‚Äôt clear what motivated them to act. This was hardly the only proceeding against Chinese agents the Justice Department chose to abandon.

In 2020, federal officials changed that Chinese national Tang Juan lied about ties to the Chinese military in order to gain access to the University of California at Davis. The FBI found an April 14, 2019 article on a Xi‚Äôan, China, healthcare forum that showed Tang in a military uniform bearing the insignia of the Civilian Cadres of the Chinese People‚Äôs Liberation Army (PLA). The FBI also found two other articles listing Tang‚Äôs employer as the People‚Äôs Liberation Army‚Äôs Air Force Medical University (AFMU), also known as the Fourth Military Medical University (FMMU).

According to court documents, Tang was part of a PLA operation to send military scientists to the United States with false covers or false statements about their true employment. Military superiors in China tasked the spies to copy and steal information from American institutions.

Tang Juan also emerged in the visa fraud case of Song Chen. According to July 20, 2020, court documents, ‚Äúan active duty People‚Äôs Liberation Army (PLA) military scientist who lied to get into the United States, attempted to destroy evidence, and lied extensively to the FBI when interviewed.‚Äù

The documents also cite Wang Xin, a visiting researcher at the University of California at San Francisco arrested on charges of visa fraud. Wang was ‚Äúin fact an active duty member in the PLA, at a level that roughly corresponded with the level of major in the United States.‚Äù Wang had ‚Äúemailed UCSF research to his PLA laboratory,‚Äù and his supervisor in China tasked Wang ‚Äúto observe and document the layout of the UCSF lab to replicate it when he returned to China.‚Äù

The court documents refer to Tang Juan, also in the United States on a J-1 visa. So was a Chinese national identified as ‚ÄúLT,‚Äù who gained access to Duke University despite affiliations with ‚Äúthe PLA General Hospital and PLA Medical Academy.‚Äù Americans have cause to wonder why the visas were granted in the first place.

A simple internet search turned up PLA and CCP ties for Tang Juan and others now facing charges. The court documents do not reveal which U.S. government officials granted the visas, and what they knew when they approved Chinese nationals with PLA and Chinese Communist Party (CCP) ties.

_source.content: [This is the problem with the bleeding heart liberal programs. You cannot say, let everyone in, then turn around and say the government and American citizens now owe it to you to finance ILLEGAL Immigrants (illegal means you didn‚Äôt follow the laws that the legal immigrants did to come into this country). So if millions of people started stealing your cars or other ‚Äòneeds‚Äô they had, and you supported that plan (because, after all, they need a car to get around), the government and I, the tax payer, should have to pay for those cars? Don‚Äôt get me wrong. I don‚Äôt want anyone living on the street, but I know that just wanting it to be so, doesn‚Äôt mean no one pays for that! A good, humanitarian idea, doesn‚Äôt just wish for Utopia and complain that it‚Äôs not so. That‚Äôs what two year olds do! The good ideas include a solution to a problem that pays for itself. Come up with an income producing plan that provides them a way to work for their housing and food (like the rest of the country/world, in fact, the very country they just left, has to do), and then you‚Äôve got a workable plan. Have investors who believe in this cause, hire these people to build apartment buildings or homes they can afford to live in while still providing an investment to the investors. Just one idea. These are my comments, not the authors]Dozens of illegal immigrants camped for a second night in the street outside Manhattan‚Äôs Watson Hotel since Sunday, protesting their relocation to a new shelter at the Brooklyn Cruise Terminal.New York City Hall said the removal of the male adults is to make space for immigrant families. But some of those who had been staying at the free three-star NYC hotel rooms after entering the country illegally through the southern border argued that the alternative is not up to scratch.Illegal immigrants told the New York Post that they shared the hotel room with only one person, and sometimes occupied the entire space themselves, including a private bathroom and shower. With easy reach to local shops and businesses, a two-trip MetroCard was also provided to each of them daily, an immigrant said to the outlet.The new facility in Red Hook, featuring clean but communal sinks and toilets, in comparison, is designed to shelter as many as 1,000 single adult men, according to officials. The isolated terminal is the city‚Äôs latest opened Humanitarian Emergency Response and Relief Center (HERRC). Videos show its massive open space filled with neatly fitted cots connected to each other.‚ÄúThe cruise ship terminal is better than the homeless shelter, where there were a lot of crazy American men and American men on drugs,‚Äô‚Äô a 42-year-old Venezuela immigrant told The Post. ‚ÄúBut the cruise ship terminal is not as good as the hotel,‚Äù he added.Despite onsite services such as medical care and laundry, several illegal immigrants who had been to the Brooklyn Cruise Terminal over the past weekend warned against the shortage of basic living standards such as heat, blankets, or storage.Fabien Levy, a spokesman for New York City Mayor Eric Adams, rejected claims of unliveable conditions. ‚Äú[T]he site is offering the same services as all other HERRCs,‚Äù Levy wrote in a late Monday post on Twitter, saying he had personally visited the Brooklyn Cruise Terminal to fact-check whispers about cold spaces.‚ÄúWe checked the thermostat and the facility is definitely warm [even saw a man wearing shorts inside],‚Äù the post reads.The mayor also promised as he toured the new facility on Monday that healthy food and snacks would be provided onsite, besides heat and blankets. A video recorded onsite also shows the mayor playing ping pong with the illegal immigrants inside the mega-shelter.‚ÄúWe just need to stop the anxiety,‚Äù Adams said, according to the footage.NYPD officers have been called in to clear the street, forcing the group of illegal immigrants to break down the tents. Yet many on Monday refused to back down and kept sleeping along the sidewalk of West 57th Street, calling for a solution. Migrant activists and volunteers offer daily supplies such as food and water to the group.Shahana Hanif, chair of the New York City Council‚Äôs Immigration Committee, condemned the forced removal of the illegal immigrants. These are my comments, not the authors]


Dozens of illegal immigrants camped for a second night in the street outside Manhattan‚Äôs Watson Hotel since Sunday, protesting their relocation to a new shelter at the Brooklyn Cruise Terminal.

New York City Hall said the removal of the male adults is to make space for immigrant families. But some of those who had been staying at the free three-star NYC hotel rooms after entering the country illegally through the southern border argued that the alternative is not up to scratch.

Illegal immigrants told the New York Post that they shared the hotel room with only one person, and sometimes occupied the entire space themselves, including a private bathroom and shower. With easy reach to local shops and businesses, a two-trip MetroCard was also provided to each of them daily, an immigrant said to the outlet.

The new facility in Red Hook, featuring clean but communal sinks and toilets, in comparison, is designed to shelter as many as 1,000 single adult men, according to officials. The isolated terminal is the city‚Äôs latest opened Humanitarian Emergency Response and Relief Center (HERRC). Videos show its massive open space filled with neatly fitted cots connected to each other.

‚ÄúThe cruise ship terminal is better than the homeless shelter, where there were a lot of crazy American men and American men on drugs,‚Äô‚Äô a 42-year-old Venezuela immigrant told The Post. ‚ÄúBut the cruise ship terminal is not as good as the hotel,‚Äù he added.

Despite onsite services such as medical care and laundry, several illegal immigrants who had been to the Brooklyn Cruise Terminal over the past weekend warned against the shortage of basic living standards such as heat, blankets, or storage.

Fabien Levy, a spokesman for New York City Mayor Eric Adams, rejected claims of unliveable conditions. ‚Äú[T]he site is offering the same services as all other HERRCs,‚Äù Levy wrote in a late Monday post on Twitter, saying he had personally visited the Brooklyn Cruise Terminal to fact-check whispers about cold spaces.

‚ÄúWe checked the thermostat and the facility is definitely warm [even saw a man wearing shorts inside],‚Äù the post reads.

The mayor also promised as he toured the new facility on Monday that healthy food and snacks would be provided onsite, besides heat and blankets. A video recorded onsite also shows the mayor playing ping pong with the illegal immigrants inside the mega-shelter.

‚ÄúWe just need to stop the anxiety,‚Äù Adams said, according to the footage.

NYPD officers have been called in to clear the street, forcing the group of illegal immigrants to break down the tents. Yet many on Monday refused to back down and kept sleeping along the sidewalk of West 57th Street, calling for a solution. Migrant activists and volunteers offer daily supplies such as food and water to the group.

Shahana Hanif, chair of the New York City Council‚Äôs Immigration Committee, condemned the forced removal of the illegal immigrants. Representing Brooklyn‚Äôs 39th District, the councilwoman urged the Adams administration to ‚Äúprioritize keeping people in proper brick-and-mortar facilities,‚Äù according to a Monday statement‚Ä¶
